net.cloud.client.file.cache

Class CacheTable

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.client.file.cache.CacheTable

  • public class CacheTable
extends java.lang.Object
    Logical object to deal with a cache table file. This requires both the cache table and cache file. Then, it supports retrieving information from both files. Neither the table nor the cache are stored in memory but rather read on demand, and the file objects it has been provided are not closed by any actions here - that is the responsibility of the caller.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CacheTable

        public CacheTable(java.io.RandomAccessFile table,
                  java.io.RandomAccessFile cache)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Create a new CacheTable object representing the given associated table and cache files. These files should already be open and ready for reading, however the position does not matter. The files may have their position changed, but this class will not close the files.
        Parameters:
        table - The cacheTable.dat file in the pairing, giving info on cache
        cache - The cache.dat file, whose info is contained in the table
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the table size could not be determined

    • Method Detail

      • getFile

        public CachedFile getFile(int index)
                   throws java.io.IOException
        Obtain a single file from the cache. The file to retrieve is the one at the given index. The index cannot be less than 0 or greater than the number of files in the cache, of course.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the file in the cache
        Returns:
        A single CachedFile representing the data from the cache
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file could not be retrieved
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the index is out of bounds

      • getFileRegion

        public CachedFileRegion getFileRegion(int startIndex,
                                      int endIndex)
                               throws java.io.IOException
        Obtain a block of files from the cache. These files are all contiguous and each of them is retrieved. The returned CachedFileRegion will contain all of these files, and they will all be loaded and ready. The block is defined by the given indices. The start index must be non-negative and less than the end index. The end index must not be greater than the number of files in the cache.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - Index of the first file to retrieve
        endIndex - Index of the last file to retrieve
        Returns:
        A CachedFileRegion containing all of the requested files
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the file(s) could not be retrieved
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the indices are invalid

      • getFilePosition

        private long getFilePosition(int index)
                      throws java.io.IOException
        Get the starting position of a file within the cache, via its index in the table. Index is assumed to be in bounds.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the file in the table
        Returns:
        The position of the file in the cache
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the position could not be read

      • getFileSize

        private int getFileSize(int index,
                        long filePosition)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Determine the size of a file in the cache. In other words, how many bytes it occupies in the cache file. Index is assumed to be in bounds.
        Parameters:
        index - Index of the file in the table
        filePosition - The location of the file within the cache. See getFilePosition(int)
        Returns:
        The size, in bytes, of the file in the cache
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If the size could not be determined, due to a file error

      • getMemoryMappedBuffer

        private java.nio.ByteBuffer getMemoryMappedBuffer(long filePos,
                                                  long fileSize)
                                           throws java.io.IOException
        Obtain a ByteBuffer which contains the data for the cache, from the given position for the given length
        Parameters:
        filePos - Position in the cache file to start at
        fileSize - How many bytes in the cache to map
        Returns:
        A ByteBuffer linked to the given part of the cache
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Some IO exception occurs

      • getRegionByteArrays

        private byte[][] getRegionByteArrays(int startIndex,
                                     int endIndex)
                              throws java.io.IOException
        Obtain a byte array for each of the files in the specified range. The byte arrays are simply initialized, they are not filled with the actual file data.
        Parameters:
        startIndex - The first file index
        endIndex - The last file index
        Returns:
        A 2D byte array where each requested file has an array sized to the file size
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an IO error occurs
